subject: Technology
title: Touch ID and Biometric Security
description: Learn Touch ID and Biometric Security in one minute.

hook.text: Typing a passcode every time you unlock your phone is annoying. Apple thought your fingerprint could replace it.

buildup.text: Touch ID launched in 2013. A sensor in the home button read your fingerprint in under a second.

discovery.text: Your fingerprint is unique. Even identical twins have different prints, making it highly secure.

twist.text: Hackers proved they could fool early sensors with a gummy bear fingerprint mold. Security improved fast.

climax.text: Biometrics expanded to Face ID, iris scanning, and voice recognition. Your body became your password.

punchline.text: Your body is now your password. You can never forget it.

quiz.question: What did Touch ID use to unlock the iPhone?
